abstract: Tidal surge which swept through Kiribati in 2015 is heightening alarms from scientists that climate change will soon make low-lying island nation uninhabitable; former Pres Anote Tong, whose administration created potential refuge in Fiji and has been encouraging job-skilled residents to emigrate, says his country's plight is worldwide climate wake-up call and its impact is very real.

headline.print_headline: Remote Pacific Nation, Threatened by Rising Seas
headline.main: A Remote Pacific Nation, Threatened by Rising Seas

snippet: Climate change is threatening the livelihoods of the people of tiny Kiribati, and even the island nation’s existence. The government is making plans for the island’s demise....
